comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: >> Forest House, located in an unknown town in Cheshire County, NH. Forest House, Marlow, NH "Russell Huntley erected the Forest House [in 1835], which was afterwards remodeled and became the [public] house owned by G.A. Petts and G.H. Messer. It was kept open only a few years." – searchroots A third story was added later.

comment.realname: Keene Public Library and the Historical Society of Cheshire County

Keene Public Library

comment.author: 76186433@N02
comment._content:
Behind the Forest House is the Tin Shop - both were destroyed by the August 1916 fire.  The Christian Church (now Jones Hall) is in the background.

Tracy Messer
Peterborough, NH
